statalign.base
Class Tree

java.lang.Object
  statalign.base.thread.Stoppable
      statalign.base.Tree

public class Tree
extends Stoppable

This is the current tree in the MCMC run. It extends Stoppable, so the MCMC run can be terminated in graphical interface mode while it calls a function in the Tree class.

Author:
miklos, novak

Field Detail

substitutionModel

public SubstitutionModel substitutionModel
Characters on this tree undergo substitutions according to this model.

hmm2

public Hmm2 hmm2
When two fragments of two sequences on two neighbor vertices of the tree are realigned, the proposed new alignment is drawn from a forward-backward sampling of this HMM. It is a simplified version of the TKF92 model.

hmm3

public HmmSilent hmm3
When two fragments of two sequences on two sibling vertices are realigned drawing a novel ancestral substring for their parent vertex, the proposed new alignment is drawn from a forward-backward sampling of this HMM. It is a pair-HMM having states emitting into the non-observable ancestral sequence.

vertex

public Vertex[] vertex
The array of vertices of the tree.

public Vertex root
The root of the tree

The name of the sequences

public double heat
The heat parameter for this MCMC chain.

public CNetwork network
Constructor Detail

Tree

public Tree(java.lang.String[] sequences,
            java.lang.String[] names,
            SubstitutionModel model,
            SubstitutionScore ss)
     throws StoppedException
This constructor generates a tree and puts aligned sequences onto it. The sequences are aligned using an iterative alignment scheme and Neighbor Joining. First pairwise alignments are used to calculate distances, and these distances are used to construct a tree using Neighbor Joining. As the tree is being constructed, sequences are aligned together in an iterative manner.

Parameters:
sequences - The sequences themselves.
names - The name of the sequences. The code calling this constructor is responsible to have the same order of sequences and their names, as it is assumed that the name of sequences[i] is names[i].
model - The time-continuous Markov model describing the substitution process of sequences
ss - The substitution score matrix that is used to obtain pairwise distances.
filename - The name of the file that contained the sequences. This will be the name of the tree, appearing in the graphical interface showing multiple alignments.
Throws:
StoppedException

rowSequences

public java.lang.String rowSequences()
It generates the array of row sequences. The format is sequence name TAB row sequence.

Returns:
